instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
HI!, i've never fix an imac.

this imac doesnt power on.

i've only the first led

when i push the power button, nothing happens

power button is ok

could you help me? i don't know where to start!


thanks

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
Any histoyy available?
What is the 820-xxxx code of your board?

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
No history 🥲🥲

Should I diamantle the mktherboard to check for the model?

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
Use Google at least...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&q=Imac+21%2C5+EMC+2428+board[/URL]

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message: So it should be 820-2641-a

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message: U7700 is a classic issue on these machines.

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message: so what should i check? this is the first time for me...

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
Replace it.
Be sure to solder it correctly...

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
without checking anything else like you teach me?!

ok i will replace it

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message: I have 5v and 3,3 on u7700: should i change it anyway?

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
5V at L7750?
If yes, don't touch it.

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message: I’ve 0v on p5vs3_reg_phase

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
Did you check with original iMac power supply?

BTW, remove the CMOS battery; board should start automatically then.

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
I have not dismantled the motherboard from the case, so it is still connected to its power supply!

It doesn bot boot without battery

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message: Post U7700 basic voltages: 17, 18, 5, 4, 24, 12.

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
Then you should have 5V at L7750.
Check diode mode to ground there.
If OK, then bad U7700...

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
Still the same 

I have 0,144mv on pin 23 of u7770

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message: Did you change U7700?

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message: Yes but not with a brand new…i can try to buy a brand new one…what do you Think?

threads.title: [help]Imac 21,5 EMC 2428 Dead
threads.message:
Never reused from other iMac.
BTW, be sure isn't "C" version...
